questions.question: What type of government did the framers of the Constitution design?

choices.answer: An Authoritarian dictatorship.
A republic where citizens rule themselves to through elected officials.
A free democracy for the people.
A monarchy where kings and queens would deem their birthright to rule.

questions.question: How did the Magna Carta pave the way for the founding fathers to create the Constitution?

choices.answer: It gave citizens the opportunity to receive an education.
It barred the king from using cruel and unjust punishment.
Answers 1 & 2.
It eventually gave citizens certain rights & everyone had to obey the law.

questions.question: How did the English Bill of Rights pave the way for the Founding Fathers to create the Constitution?

choices.answer: It affirmed the right to a trial by jury.
It outlawed excessive fines as well as cruel and unusual punishment.
It allowed citizens to bear arms and affirmed the writ of habeus corpus.
All of the above.

questions.question: In 1619 which American Colony set up the House of Burgesses, Britains government that was established in all 13 states?

choices.answer: New York
Pennsylvania
Michigan
Virginia

questions.question: What is significant about the Mayflower Compact?

choices.answer: It was the first legal docuement of self government in North America.
It was a promise of peace with Native Americans.
It declared independence from Britain.
None of the above

questions.question: What was French thinker Baron De Montesquieu's idea that had an influence on creating the U.S. Constitution?

choices.answer: Common Sense
All people had natural rights to life, liberty and property.
Government is an agreement between the ruler and the ruled.
A proper functioning government should have seperation of powers.

questions.question: How did John Locke influence the founding fathers on writing the Constitution of the United States?

choices.answer: The ruler must enforce the laws and protect the people.
If a ruler violates natural rights, the people have a right to rebel.
The Constitution was looked at as a contract between the people & the gov't
All of the above.

questions.question: The ideas of John Locke & Baron De Montesquieu come from the ideas from

choices.answer: The Dark ages
European Enlightenment.
The Great Awakening.
The Industrial Revolution.

questions.question: What was the group of people called that opposed the Constitution?

choices.answer: Federalists
Democratic-Republicans
AntiFederalists
Whigs

questions.question: What did the Anti-Federalists want to do with the Constitution?

choices.answer: Revert it back to the Articles of Confederation.
Take some ideas from the original Constitution and create a better one.
Add a Bill of Rights.
Ensure divine rights to a monarch.
